verses.verse: Now Joab<WH3097> the son<WH1121> of Zeruiah<WH6870> perceived<WH3045> that the king's heart<WH3820> [was inclined] toward<WH5921> Absalom.<WH53>

So Joab<WH3097> sent<WH7971> to Tekoa<WH8620> and brought<WH3947> a wise<WH2450> woman<WH802> from there<WH8033> and said<WH559> to her, "Please<WH4994> pretend<WH56> to be a mourner,<WH56> and put<WH3847> on mourning<WH60> garments<WH899> now,<WH4994> and do not anoint<WH5480> yourself with oil,<WH8081> but be like a woman<WH802> who has been mourning<WH56> for the dead<WH4191> many<WH7227> days;<WH3117>
then go<WH935> to the king<WH4428> and speak<WH1696> to him in this<WH2088> manner.<WH1697> "So Joab<WH3097> put<WH7760> the words<WH1697> in her mouth.<WH6310>

Now when the woman<WH802> of Tekoa<WH8621> spoke<WH559> to the king,<WH4428> she fell<WH5307> on her face<WH639> to the ground<WH776> and prostrated<WH7812> herself and said,<WH559> "Help,<WH3467> O king.<WH4428>"
And the king<WH4428> said<WH559> to her, "What<WH4100> is your trouble?" And she answered,<WH559> "Truly<WH61> I am a widow,<WH490> for my husband<WH376> is dead.<WH4191>

"And your maidservant<WH8198> had two<WH8147> sons,<WH1121> but the two<WH8147> of them struggled<WH5327> together<WH5327> in the field,<WH7704> and there<WH369> was no<WH369> one<WH369> to separate<WH5337> them, so one<WH259> struck<WH5221> the other<WH259> and killed<WH4191> him.

"Now behold,<WH2009> the whole<WH3605> family<WH4940> has risen<WH6965> against<WH5921> your maidservant,<WH8198> and they say,<WH559> 'Hand<WH5414> over<WH5414> the one who struck<WH5221> his brother,<WH251> that we may put<WH4191> him to death<WH4191> for the life<WH5315> of his brother<WH251> whom<WH834> he killed,<WH2026> and destroy<WH8045> the heir<WH3423> also.<WH1571>' Thus they will extinguish<WH3518> my coal<WH1513> which<WH834> is left,<WH7604> so as to leave<WH7760> my husband<WH376> neither<WH1115> name<WH8034> nor<WH1115> remnant<WH7611> on the face<WH6440> of the earth.<WH127>"
Then the king<WH4428> said<WH559> to the woman,<WH802> "Go<WH1980> to your house,<WH1004> and I will give<WH6680> orders<WH6680> concerning<WH5921> you."

And the woman<WH802> of Tekoa<WH8621> said<WH559> to the king,<WH4428> "O my lord,<WH113> the king,<WH4428> the iniquity<WH5771> is on me and my father's house,<WH1004> but the king<WH4428> and his throne<WH3678> are guiltless.<WH9345>"
So the king<WH4428> said,<WH559> "Whoever speaks<WH1696> to you, bring<WH935> him to me, and he will not touch<WH5060> you anymore.<WH3254> <WH5750>"

Then she said,<WH559> "Please<WH4994> let the king<WH4428> remember<WH2142> the Lord<WH3068> your God,<WH430> [so that] the avenger<WH1350> of blood<WH1818> may not continue<WH7235> to destroy,<WH7843> lest<WH3808> they destroy<WH8045> my son.<WH1121>" And he said,<WH559> "As the Lord<WH3068> lives,<WH2416> not one hair<WH8185> of your son<WH1121> shall fall<WH5307> to the ground.<WH776>"
Then the woman<WH802> said,<WH559> "Please<WH4994> let your maidservant<WH8198> speak<WH1696> a word<WH1697> to my lord<WH113> the king.<WH4428>" And he said,<WH559> "Speak.<WH1696>"

And the woman<WH802> said,<WH559> "Why<WH4100> then have you planned<WH2803> such<WH2088> a thing<WH2088> against<WH5921> the people<WH5971> of God<WH430>? For in speaking<WH1696> this<WH2088> word<WH1697> the king<WH4428> is as one<WH818> who<WH818> is guilty,<WH818> [in that] the king<WH4428> does not bring<WH7725> back<WH7725> his banished<WH5080> one.<WH5080>

"For we shall surely<WH4191> die<WH4191> and are like water<WH4325> spilled<WH5064> on the ground<WH776> which<WH834> cannot<WH3808> be gathered<WH622> up again. Yet God<WH430> does not take<WH5375> away life,<WH5315> but plans<WH2803> ways<WH4284> so that the banished<WH5080> one<WH5080> may not be cast<WH5080> out from him.

"Now<WH6258> the reason<WH834> I have come<WH935> to speak<WH1696> this<WH2088> word<WH1697> to my lord<WH113> the king<WH4428> is because<WH3588> the people<WH5971> have made<WH3372> me afraid;<WH3372> so your maidservant<WH8198> said,<WH559> 'Let me now<WH4994> speak<WH1696> to the king,<WH4428> perhaps<WH194> the king<WH4428> will perform<WH6213> the request<WH1697> of his maidservant.<WH519>

'For the king<WH4428> will hear<WH8085> and deliver<WH5337> his maidservant<WH519> from the hand<WH3709> of the man<WH376> who would destroy<WH8045> both<WH3162> me and my son<WH1121> from the inheritance<WH5159> of God.<WH430>'

"Then your maidservant<WH8198> said,<WH559> 'Please<WH4994> let the word<WH1697> of my lord<WH113> the king<WH4428> be comforting,<WH4496> for as the angel<WH4397> of God,<WH430> so<WH3651> is my lord<WH113> the king<WH4428> to discern<WH8085> good<WH9185> and evil.<WH9563> And may the Lord<WH3068> your God<WH430> be with you.'"

Then the king<WH4428> answered<WH6030> and said<WH559> to the woman,<WH802> "Please<WH4994> do not hide<WH3582> anything<WH1697> from me that I am about to ask<WH7592> you." And the woman<WH802> said,<WH559> "Let my lord<WH113> the king<WH4428> please<WH4994> speak.<WH1696>"

So the king<WH4428> said,<WH559> "Is the hand<WH3027> of Joab<WH3097> with you in all<WH3605> this<WH2088>?" And the woman<WH802> answered<WH6030> and said,<WH559> "As your soul<WH5315> lives,<WH2416> my lord<WH113> the king,<WH4428> no<WH518> one can turn<WH3231> to the right<WH3231> or to the left<WH8041> from anything<WH3605> that my lord<WH113> the king<WH4428> has spoken.<WH1696> Indeed,<WH3588> it was your servant<WH5650> Joab<WH3097> who<WH1931> commanded<WH6680> me, and it was he who put<WH7760> all<WH3605> these<WH428> words<WH1697> in the mouth<WH6310> of your maidservant;<WH8198>

in order<WH5668> to change<WH5437> the appearance<WH6440> of things<WH1697> your servant<WH5650> Joab<WH3097> has done<WH6213> this<WH2088> thing.<WH1697> But my lord<WH113> is wise,<WH2450> like the wisdom<WH2451> of the angel<WH4397> of God,<WH430> to know<WH3045> all<WH3605> that is in the earth.<WH776> "

Then the king<WH4428> said<WH559> to Joab,<WH3097> "Behold<WH2009> now,<WH4994> I will surely do<WH6213> this<WH2088> thing;<WH1697> go<WH1980> therefore, bring<WH7725> back<WH7725> the young<WH5288> man<WH5288> Absalom.<WH53>"

And Joab<WH3097> fell<WH5307> on his face<WH6440> to the ground,<WH776> prostrated<WH7812> himself and blessed<WH1288> the king;<WH4428> then Joab<WH3097> said,<WH559> "Today<WH3117> your servant<WH5650> knows<WH3045> that I have found<WH4672> favor<WH2580> in your sight,<WH5869> O my lord,<WH113> the king,<WH4428> in that the king<WH4428> has performed<WH6213> the request<WH1697> of his servant.<WH5650>"
So Joab<WH3097> arose<WH6965> and went<WH1980> to Geshur,<WH1650> and brought<WH935> Absalom<WH53> to Jerusalem.<WH3389>

However the king<WH4428> said,<WH559> "Let him turn<WH5437> to his own house,<WH1004> and let him not see<WH7200> my face.<WH6440>" So Absalom<WH53> turned<WH5437> to his own house<WH1004> and did not see<WH7200> the king's face.<WH6440>

Now in all<WH3605> Israel<WH3478> was no<WH3808> one<WH376> as handsome<WH3303> as Absalom,<WH53> so highly<WH3966> praised;<WH1984> from the sole<WH3709> of his foot<WH7272> to the crown<WH6936> of his head<WH6936> there was no<WH3808> defect<WH9249> in him.

And when he cut<WH1548> the hair of his head<WH7218> (and it was at the end<WH7093> of every year<WH3117> that he cut<WH1548> [it,] for it was heavy<WH3515> on him so he cut<WH1548> it), he weighed<WH8254> the hair<WH8181> of his head<WH7218> at<WH200> shekels<WH8255> by the king's weight.<WH68>

And to Absalom<WH53> there were born<WH3205> three<WH7969> sons,<WH1121> and one<WH259> daughter<WH1323> whose name<WH8034> was Tamar;<WH8559> she was a woman<WH802> of beautiful<WH3303> appearance.<WH4758>
Now Absalom<WH53> lived<WH3427> two full<WH3117> years<WH8141> in Jerusalem,<WH3389> and did not see<WH7200> the king's face.<WH6440>

Then Absalom<WH53> sent<WH7971> for Joab,<WH3097> to send<WH7971> him to the king,<WH4428> but he would<WH14> not come<WH935> to him. So he sent<WH7971> again<WH5750> a second<WH8145> time,<WH8145> but he would<WH14> not come.<WH935>

Therefore he said<WH559> to his servants,<WH5650> "See,<WH7200> Joab's field<WH2513> is next<WH413> to mine, and he has barley<WH8184> there;<WH8033> go<WH1980> and set<WH3341> it on fire.<WH784>" So Absalom's servants<WH5650> set<WH3341> the field<WH2513> on fire.<WH784>
Then Joab<WH3097> arose,<WH6965> came<WH935> to Absalom<WH53> at his house<WH1004> and said<WH559> to him, "Why<WH4100> have your servants<WH5650> set<WH3341> my field<WH2513> on fire<WH784>?"

And Absalom<WH53> answered<WH559> Joab,<WH3097> "Behold,<WH2009> I sent<WH7971> for you, saying,<WH559> 'Come<WH935> here,<WH2008> that I may send<WH7971> you to the king,<WH4428> to say,<WH559> "Why<WH4100> have I come<WH935> from Geshur<WH1650>? It would be better<WH2896> for me still<WH5750> to be there.<WH8033> "'Now<WH6258> therefore, let me see<WH7200> the king's face;<WH6440> and if<WH518> there<WH3426> is iniquity<WH5771> in me, let him put<WH4191> me to death.<WH4191>"

So when Joab<WH3097> came<WH935> to the king<WH4428> and told<WH5046> him, he called<WH7121> for Absalom.<WH53> Thus he came<WH935> to the king<WH4428> and prostrated<WH7812> himself on his face<WH639> to the ground<WH776> before<WH6440> the king,<WH4428> and the king<WH4428> kissed<WH5401> Absalom.<WH53>
